intro: Pfaffia grandiflora, commonly known as curaçao root, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its roots are the primary part used, known for their purported medicinal properties. Pfaffia grandiflora thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil.
